revised_title: Exchange Energy Functional in Hartree-Fock Theory of Inhomogeneous Electron Gas
tldr: The authors develop a theory based on a local one-body potential that reproduces the exact charge density in a many-electron system. They derive a perturbation expansion of the Dirac density matrix in terms of the Hartree-Fock density, obtaining the exchange energy. This work provides a useful generalization of Dirac-Slater theory for atoms, molecules, and non-metallic crystals, and it can help understand the electronic structure of materials.
